meanings.definition: Plants that thrive in calcareous soil.
meanings.sent1: The calcicoles in our garden are flourishing in the limestone-rich soil.
meanings.sent2: Calcicoles like to grow in areas with high levels of calcium in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The calcicoles in the yard seem to have a special love for the chalky ground.
meanings.sent4: The garden resembled a paradise for the calcicoles, with its abundance of limestone.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green of the calcicoles against the white rocks was a stunning sight.

meanings.definition: Organisms that prefer or require calcium-rich environments.
meanings.sent1: The calcicoles in the ocean need calcium to build their shells.
meanings.sent2: Calcicoles, like snails, rely on calcium for their survival.
meanings.sent3: The tiny calcicoles in the soil were throwing a calcium party!
meanings.sent4: The calcicoles in the coral reef danced around their calcium-rich home.
meanings.sent5: The calcicoles in the cave were busy collecting calcium for their needs.
